Purveyor.Name: D4 on Featherston
Purveyor.Description: Save yourself the expense of an OE and come have a Real Irish Experience in D4 on Featherston. As the name suggests (D4 is for Dublin4), we've brought the best of Ireland over with us and dropped it right in the Heart of Wellington. We've great food, great beers and outstanding service due, in no small part, to the legendary hospitality of the Irish owners and staff. From quiet mid-winter Sunday evenings by the fire to controlled chaos on big sporting nights (or mornings!!), we've seen and done it all. So be it breakie on the cheap, a quick "in 'n' out" lunch, a glass of your favourite beer or having the craic 'til 3 in the morning, we feel, in D4, there's something for everyone.
Purveyor.FoodDescription:
Our food is contemporary New Zealand/European in style.
We offer the complete package: breakfast, bar snacks, light lunches, a full evening menu, function set menus, a canapes menu and a kids menu

Purveyor.Name: The Bruhaus
Purveyor.Description:
Welcome to the bruhaus!
We are your local, independent ale and wine bar in the Wellington CBD!
We’ve got more than 160 local and international beers available by the bottle, 29 taps offering local craft beer such as Wellington’s Yeastie Boys, Parrotdog, Panhead & Tuatara, along with Three Boys, Renaissance, 8 Wired, Mikes and Croucher from around New Zealand. Combine that with our imports of Beers from the USA such as Rogue, Left Coast and Almanac. European Beers including London Pride, ESB, Hofbrau, Carlsberg and more plus an extensive wine list with bottles chosen from Marlborough, Central Otago and Martinborough there is something for everyone!
Purveyor.FoodDescription: We’re open from 11.45am-late, Monday - Sunday. We offer a delicious and changing menu for lunch and dinner, carrying right on through until late with our snack menu on offer as well.

Purveyor.Name: Fork & Brewer
Purveyor.Description: Wellingtons only Brew Bar! We have 30 different craft beers and ciders on tap, including a range of our own beers brewed on the premises. Along with our awesome beer range, our menu has a beer matched to every dish. With awesome sun on our huge balcony and possibly the longest leaner in town, come on down and join us for your favourite drop of NZ Craft Beer.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: Full range of bar snacks, lunch menu and dinner menu as well as awesome platters to share. Modern NZ/ European food with a hint of Gastropub! Every dish on our menu is handcrafted to match with one of our extensive selection of craft beers.

Purveyor.Name: Little Beer Quarter
Purveyor.Description: LBQ is the boutique beer bar of Wellington, located in the hidden away Edward St Precinct. LBQ has 11 beers and one cider on tap and over 100 bottled beers from both NZ and around the world. We also have a seperate comfortable and sheltered Cigarro and sell a range of cigars, plus a great wine list, cocktails and hoptails.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: LBQ offers Gastro pub style food matched with beer, plus pizza. Open for lunch, bar snacks and dinner, we offer full restaurant service. Bookings are preferred.

Purveyor.Name: The Tap Haus
Purveyor.Description: Boasting one of Wellington's largest number of beer taps and a large bottled selection (including some rare ones), we are here to meet your beer expectations and expand your beer horizons.
Purveyor.StreetAddress: Corner of Dixon and Victoria Streets
Purveyor.FoodDescription:
We're under new management and a have a new identity and new menus to match! Come in and try some of our new daily deals like $10 express burger lunches, pizza and a beer tasting tray for $19.50, and $15 Hawkes Bay jugs on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesdays.
On our menu you'll find international tastes and flavours like the pulled pork quesadillas, capsicum and haloumi risotto and Mediterranean pasta salad. There are also the staple pub favourites such as sirloin steak, burgers, fish 'n' chips and gourmet pizzas that pair well with our extensive range of beer.

Purveyor.Name: Hashigo Zake
Purveyor.Description: Hashigo Zake boasts New Zealand's most exciting beer list. You'll find an ever-changing array of local and imported tap beer, many unavailable anywhere else. We also have a carefully selected range of wines, whiskies, ciders and sakes. All in an atmospheric, underground haven from the chaos of nearby Courtenay Place.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: A small menu designed for beer drinkers needing satisfying snacks and meals to accompany their tasting. Noodle soup, pies, daily specials and some esoteric and stimulating snacks.

Purveyor.Name: Malthouse
Purveyor.Description: Wellington's original craft beer bar, now in it's 21st year! With our wide range of tap and bottled beers, we have a beer for you - Guaranteed!
Purveyor.FoodDescription: From the Malthouse kitchen we offer customers a range of hot, tasty and filling pizzas and a selection of bar snacks.

Purveyor.Name: The Hop Garden
Purveyor.Description: Nestled in the fringe of the city, on the lower slopes of Mount Victoria, The Hop Garden is a craft beer bar and restaurant with a focus on New Zealand microbreweries, quality wines and outstanding service. Come and enjoy a glass of New Zealand's finest in our light and airy garden-patio bar, complete with glass roof and established vines - a relaxed and social atmosphere which belies our close proximity to the hustle and bustle of the city.
Purveyor.FoodDescription:
Established in 2011, The Hop Garden was conceived as a haven for great beer, wine and food.
With a focus on New Zealand’s craft breweries, and with a fine selection of local and international wines, The Hop Garden combines a touch of sophistication with friendly charm in a relaxed environment — a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Chef Gavin Grant leads a passionate kitchen team, producing rustic fare influenced by the cuisines of Europe, the Mediterranean and beyond. Our food is prepared with love and dedication, and we use free range, locally sourced and seasonal products where possible.
Perfect for both special occasions and as your local bar and restaurant, we aim to deliver value for money without compromising on ingredients, integrity or quality.

Purveyor.Name: Southern Cross
Purveyor.Description: For over 100 years our place here in Te Aro, Wellington, has been a favourite meeting place for locals. We love being a part of the community and we are ready to throw in the hard yards to make sure everyone who visits us has a great experience. The Cross has something for everyone - have a look around and choose the perfect spot to suit your mood. Each area has been designed to create a different experience, a different ambience. Bring in your team from work, your mates, your kids, your grandparents, your study group, your special someone, your laptop or your party guests - we can set you up with a space, top-notch food and drinks to suit your occasion.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: Here at The Southern Cross we love taking care of our guests - and what better way to show that than with food! We believe in cooking from scratch, offering top-notch nibbles, mains and home baking. We recognise that using fresh, local produce wherever possible results in a great dish for your plate. We're happy to be able to offer you a great range of vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free kai. If you have any dietary quirks, please don't be afraid to sing out! We use only free-range eggs and pork in The Southern Cross kitchen. We take bookings in our Dining Room - just give us a bell to book a table.

Purveyor.Name: Kelburn Village Pub
Purveyor.Description: Located in the heart of historic Kelburn Village, and just a short walk from the top of the Cable Car, the local pub is a great place to unwind and relax after a hard day in the city. Meet the locals, shoot some pool, share some tapas or just relax under the sun on our terrace.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: Authentic, traditional, artisan. Served in a relaxed informal setting, our all day Tapas menu gives you a chance to share and enjoy some flavours from around the world whilst each evening we also offer a choice of freshly prepared main course and dessert. Weekend brunch is served from 12.

Purveyor.Name: Sprig & Fern
Purveyor.Description: The Sprig and Fern Tinakori Rd Tavern in Thorndon is a marriage of the traditional English Pub with a classic Kiwi Taven. The S&F proudly has no TVs, no pokies and no pool tables, just great conversation and 19 taps of award winning craft beer and ciders. The tavern has a wide range of craft beers from Blonde to Porter and also seasonal brews and ciders. The beer you drink in the tavern is brewed in the same way as the beer that won 11 medals at the BrewNZ International Beer Awards in 2013 in Wellington and 4 medals at the Australian International Beer Awards in 2012.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: If you need a bite to eat the tavern serves simple bar snacks (incl. the very popular curly fries). Cosa Nostra deliver pizzas and Indus do a curry night on Thursdays.

Purveyor.Name: Golding's Free Dive
Purveyor.Description: Taking inspiration from the American dive bar, Golding's pays homage to the neighbourhood bars of North America and Europe. With craft beer being a vital catalyst, Golding's brings together the textures, feel and energy of its central city neighbourhood environment and creates a truly sincere and unique experience. Golding's friendly, highly trained and knowledgeable staff will enrich your visit and make sure you get the most out of your time spent exploring New Zealand and international craft beers. Beer is Love.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: Hot fresh pizza delivered from the iconic Pizza Pomodoro across the way. A range of tasty toasted sandwiches, Six Barrel Soda and filter coffee from Red Rabbit Coffee Co and Supreme.

Purveyor.Name: Bebemos
Purveyor.Description: Situated on the corner of Riddiford & Hall St is Newtown's newest bar & restaurant, mixing the best of NZ craft beers with a splash of South American vibrancy. Featuring nine rotating taps, over 50 bottled beers, a hand pull, & South Amercian influenced cuisine.

Purveyor.Name: Bin44 Restaurant & Bar
Purveyor.Description: Come down to Bin44 Restaurant + Bar on Queens Wharf waterfront for great food, a fantastic selection of craft beers and some good old blues playing to create the perfect atmosphere. We are the only Craft beer bar on the waterfront, with a wide selection of craft beers on tap and in bottles. We have over 60 different craft beers on offer, that we have carefully selected to satisfy the beer nerd in you! "Beer is living proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy" - Benjamin Franklin

Purveyor.Name: Black Dog Brew Co.
Purveyor.Description: BlackDog micro brewery is situated in the heart of Wellington, so come sniff us out to experience a range of quality craft beers, our friendly well trained staff at the Blair Street Brewery are always on hand to talk you through a drop or two and more than happy to answer any questions about how we brew on site.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: Perfect beer drinking food, from light snacks to group platters.

Purveyor.Name: Rogue & Vagabond
Purveyor.Description: The Rogue & Vagabond craft beer bar, nestled just off Wellington's vibrant Cuba St in Glover Park, has been described as "like having a beer at your mates place". The Rogue & Vagabond is a lively and easy going bar with a large outdoor area for you to laze away the summer on a bean bag in the sun. The Rogue & Vagabond offers live music 4 nights a week and boasts 19 beer taps so there will always be something here for you! We are also a dog friendly bar, so bring your pooch down and introduce them to Bruce our doggie bouncer!
Purveyor.FoodDescription: The best freshly made pizza in town, tasty and filling burgers and rolls, and a great snack menu

Purveyor.Name: Queen of Jackson
Purveyor.Description: Queen of Jackson bar and eatery will indicate a nostalgic upbeat London experience (baring the bad service and grumpy landlady) situated right in the heart of Jackson Street. We provide multi-levels of social abundance, sharing your table is not uncommon here. Neither is tasting from the ever evolving craft beer, fine wine, premium cocktails and an International sharing plate range. The ROOFTOP GARDEN BAR will be opening soon! Where you will find full bar facilities, heated seats and full cover for all year round weather protection. Perfect for Imbibing! eat. drink. socialise!

Purveyor.Name: Basque
Purveyor.Description: Basque is based on the eating and drinking style of Northern Spain with its streets of tapas bars, where you can pop in and try a range of pintxos (pronounced pinchos) from off the bar. Pintxos are bite sized flavoursome tapas, $2.5 each and changing daily; they go down magnificently with one of our ten craft tap beers, sparkling cava or sangria. We also have full tapas and dinner menus, a hand-pull, and an extensive range of Spanish craft beers to sample. Cider features widely too, with Zeffer on tap and an ever evolving range of Spanish ciders in the fridge.
Purveyor.FoodDescription: Pintxos are bite sized flavoursome tapas, $2.5 each and changing daily. We also have full tapas and dinner menus.

Purveyor.Name: Meow
Purveyor.Description: Head to Meow Tuesday - Sunday for live music - jazz, latin, big-band, local band and top NZ acts. Excellent organic food, boutique beer range and top-shelf Whisky selection.

Purveyor.Name: San Fran
Purveyor.Description: Wellington's best live music venue. Hosting the greatest local and international live bands, DJ's and comedians. Award winning hospitality. See you soon.

Purveyor.Name: Valhalla
Purveyor.Description: Valhalla boasts 10 taps dedicated to craft beer, serving up a fine selection of local and international craft beers. We regularly rotate our beer list depending on availability, popularity, and monthly specials. Choose your background music with our in house jukebox catering to all tastes from 60 - 80s Rock classics to Punk, Hardcore, and Death Metal. As a music venue from 8pm most nights, 154 Vivian Street has been the starting point for some of New Zealand's biggest names in Rock, Punk and Metal. With good beers in hand, it's a tradition that we hope to proudly continue.

Purveyor.Name: Crafters & Co.
Purveyor.Description: Wellington's brand new craft beer establishment & future rooftop bar. Crafters & Co's mission is to provide it's customers with New Zealand's best craft beverage & product selection. From 8am onwards, alcohol is served on premises (licensed until 3am) & or takeaway (including flagons & growlers) (takeaway license until 10pm) 7 days a week. For promotion, Crafters & Co. run an everyday happy hour from 4pm-7pm & All Day Sunday Sesh ($2 off all tap beer and house wine!) Check out the Crafters & Co menu and enjoy great beer, all day waffles, burger sliders and delicious treats.

Purveyor.Name: Regional Wines & Spirits
Purveyor.Description: Wellington's finest bottle store for beer, wine, whisky and spirits alike. Pioneers of craft beer distribution in Wellington. 'Fill your own' available from our range of chilled taps.

Purveyor.Name: New World Thorndon
Purveyor.Description: New World Thorndon have excelled at offering a fantastic range of bottled craft beer alongside the usual mainstream selection you'd find in a supermarket. Over 600 different craft & imported beers available! Grab a few bottles next time you're doing your grocery shopping.

Purveyor.Name: New World Island Bay
Purveyor.Description: We have a great range of every day supermarket products. We are known for our extensive range of organics & gluten free products. Our craft beer range is among the best in the country with a large presence of New Zealand's best small breweries.

Purveyor.Name: Cellar Room Karori
Purveyor.Description: Nestled at the city end of Karori, the Cellar Room has been providing a diverse range of craft beers, premium wines and fine spirits for over five years. Come over and speak to Mike and the team and see what we have to offer.

Purveyor.Name: Tuatara Brewing
Purveyor.Description: To say that Tuatara Brewery has taken off in the last few years is an understatement. Heck, we've been propelled into orbit. The local demand for good beer is insatiable, and with volumes running at about a million litres a year we've become one of the leading lights in the craft industry. It probably helps that we're based in Wellington where beer appreciation is not so much a cult as a full-blown religion. (The legendary Malthouse in Courtenay Place functions as the high altar.) Today you'll find Tuatara all over the country, even in the local supermarket, as well as at selected spots around the world.

Purveyor.Name: ParrotDog Brewery
Purveyor.Description: Wellington based ParrotDog Brewing Limited, famously headed by the three Matts (Kristofski, Warner & Stevens), hit the local craft beer radar in a BIG way with the hugely successful release of their first commercially brewed contract beer 'BitterBitch'. In late 2011, the decision was made to open their own brewery in Wellington City. After six months of planning and installation, the brewery is now in production on Vivian Street. ParrotDog operates an off license at the brewery for Fill-Your-Owns and merchandise, so feel welcome to head on down to fill up a rigger of the city's freshest and finest.

Purveyor.Name: Funk Estate
Purveyor.Description: Just four dudes making some groovy beers! With no brewery and no employees, we don't need to crank out a bunch of same old to keep going. This gives us the freedom to brew what we want at the most appropriate brewery. With innovation underpinning our recipes and four experienced home brewers experimenting with flavours, including the Wellington renowned Shigeo Takagi, expect your next beer from Funk Estate to be a little different.

Purveyor.Name: Garage Project
Purveyor.Description: Starting on a tiny pilot brewery in the old petrol station in Aro Valley, Garage Project produced more than 40 different beers in their first year of brewing in Wellington. They are committed to experimentation, doing something new, and frequently collaborating with talented people of all kinds. With a much larger-scale kit now installed, their beers are making their way to more bars, more often, but the spirit of boldness and tinkering remains. You can see the brewery in operation from the cellar door, have samples of the beers on tap and purchase take-away bottles, cans, and flagons plus posters, t-shirts and other merchandise.

Purveyor.Name: Yeastie Boys
Purveyor.Description: The Yeastie Boys are the dynamic duo of New Zealand's craft beer scene. They burst onto the beer landscape with two trophies for their flagship porter Pot Kettle Black at BrewNZ 2009 and have remained firmly ensconced there ever since. Their latest achievements include a trifecta of major international awards in the last year including Champion Beer at The Asia Beer Awards (for Pot Kettle Black), People's Choice at The Great Australasian Beer SpecTAPular (for Gunnamatta), and the Morton Coutts Trophy for Innovation at the Brewers Guild of New Zealand Awards (for Rex Attitude). The Yeastie Boys say that they stay ahead of the game by being food and drink lovers first and foremost and postmodern craft beer cult heroes on the side. In fact, the brewing business is a part time gig for both Stu and Sam who have day jobs in unrelated industries.

Purveyor.Name: Baylands Brewery
Purveyor.Description: We are a new brewery and online brew supplies business based in Newlands, Wellington. The creation of Aidan & Nikki Styles and Steve & Kim Young, a passionate business brewing great beers and supplying the brewing community. We only have a 300L system. It's Baylands Brewery, because we are on Baylands Drive in Newlands. The brewery is in our double garage.

Purveyor.Name: Panhead Custom Ales
Purveyor.Description: Here at Panhead Custom Ales we apply every bit of our skill, creativity and impeccable taste to the business of brewing great craft beer. We love to strip a brew back to its essence and rebuild it in a way that honours tradition as well as the alchemy of creation. At our new brewery headquarters in Upper Hutt we're turning out beers with character bursting from the glass, streamlined vehicles for malt, yeast and serious hopping. Enjoy them, share them and let us know what you think.

Location.StreetAddress: Unit 21, South Pacific Tyres Industrial Park, Blenheim Street

Purveyor.Name: Kereru Brewing
Purveyor.Description: We brew both traditional and gluten-free craft beer. Our mission is to produce fresh, locally-supplied beers made from the finest ingredients available. The beers we make are vegan and free of chemical preservatives. (Hops, the low ph of beer and alcohol are all natural preservatives). Wherever possible we use New Zealand Gladfield malts and New Zealand grown hops to celebrate the marvellous qualities and flavours which are part of our local landscape.

Purveyor.Name: Choice Bros
Purveyor.Description: Choice Bros is a gypsy brewing project based in Brooklyn, Wellington. With the motto 'Beer as Art', the focus of Choice Bros is not to create another IPA or Pale Ale, there are enough amazing ones available so why brew something we can already get? Choice Bros is all about brewing interesting styles and putting a local twist on them. Using the freshest New Zealand malts and hops whenever possible, we try to keep it local and unique. Whether it be a 'traditional' English Burton Ale with a twist or a 'Hand Pulled Pork' Bacon Ale ('Meat Beer - It's the future'), our aim is to make you push your flavor boundaries.
